issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
This test case introduced by YARN-3131 works well on CapacityScheduler but not on FairScheduler, since CS doesn't allow dynamically create a queue, while FS supports it. So if you give a random queue name, CS will reject it, but FS will create a new queue for it by default. 
One simple solution is to specific CS in this test case. /cc [~lichangleo]. I was thinking about creating another test case for FS. But for the code introduced by YARN-3131, it may be not necessary.

comments.body: agree that change in YARN-3131 is CS specific, and that change was originally driven by some problem encountered in Tez
[~lichangleo], thanks for the quick reply and background of YARN-3131.

If the test is capacity scheduler specific, should it be in the capacity scheduler tests? If the goal is to check the YarnClient behavior, may be the name of the test should reflect it is testing only capacity scheduler?
Thanks [~kasha] for the review. Its goal is to test YarnClient behavior. I've change the name to {{testSubmitIncorrectQueueToCapacityScheduler}}.
